City Limits exists to inform democracy and empower citizens to create a more just city. City Limits is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit funded by foundation support, ad sponsorship and donations from readers. 1976 City Limits founded to cover issues affecting low-income communities in NYC, focusing on housing, development, and government policy. 1980s Expanded reporting to include more in-depth investigations on homelessness, healthcare, and urban planning. 1990s Became a go-to source for in-depth analysis of NYC policies and grassroots movements. Launched special projects focusing on welfare reform and neighborhood revitalization. 2000 Transitioned from print to digital publication, increasing accessibility and reach. 2009 Merged with the Center for an Urban Future, enhancing its capacity for investigative reporting on urban challenges. 2010 Relaunched as an independent nonprofit newsroom with a renewed mission to highlight underserved communities. 2016 Celebrated 40 years of impactful journalism, continuing to provide essential coverage on social justice, urban policy, and economic inequality in NYC. Our Team Gary Clemons Executive Director Gary Clemons is a seasoned non-profit executive with 25+ years of experience and a passion for supporting marginalized communities. He tripled the budget and expanded services at Friends of the Children New York, becoming a leader in strategic growth and community partnerships. In his free time, Gary enjoys interior design, traveling, and spending time with his dog, Biggie, while continuing to move the CULTURE forward. Jeanmarie Evelly Executive Editor Jeanmarie Evelly, City Limits’ Executive Editor since 2021, joined the team in 2018, previously serving as youth program manager, deputy editor, and managing editor. A veteran metro reporter, she covered Astoria and Long Island City for DNAinfo.com and reported for Bronx community papers, including the award-winning Norwood News. She holds degrees from SUNY New Paltz, the CUNY Graduate School of Journalism, and an MFA from Queens College. She lives in Sunset Park, Brooklyn. List Item Daniel Parra Spanish Language Senior Reporter/Editor Daniel, City Limits’ Spanish-language editor/reporter, is a seasoned investigative reporter from Colombia. He has worked as a freelancer for more than seven years and has covered war, politics, religion, culture, fashion, and beers. Daniel loves poetry, short stories, and long-form journalism. Fran Reilly Director of Strategic Initiatives Fran Reilly, Director of Strategic Initiatives and Youth Program Development, previously served as Co-Executive Director and Executive Director/Publisher. She leads strategic partnership funding and the youth internship program, CLARIFY.  Earlier in her career she was a  business development executive on multiple national media startups. She holds an MFA in creative writing. A Bronx native, she lives in Beacon, NY. Mariana Simões Senior Reporter, Climate and the Environment Mariana Simões, who joined City Limits in 2023, covers climate and the environment. A Brazilian investigative journalist, her work has appeared in The New York Times, The Economist, Vice, and more. A Columbia J-school alum, she has led award-winning projects and directed Brazil’s first journalism cultural center. Adi Talwar Contributing photographer City limits board Martha Nelson, chair Former SVP and Editor-in-Chief of Yahoo! and former Editor-in-Chief of Time Inc. Neill Coleman, vice chair Principal, Mission Magnified Consulting Mark Edmiston, treasurer Managing Partner, Civil Management LLC Andrew Breslau Senior Vice President for Communications and Marketing, Downtown Alliance Stephen Fee VP, Communications at Enterprise Community Partners Erica González Martínez Deputy Director, Power4PuertoRico David R. CONTRIBUTED PHOTO Facebook Twitter Bluesky WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save Gretchen Teske A popular Rock Island restaurant and bar is closing for good April 1. Subscribe today and support local journalism! Owners of City Limits Saloon & Grill, 4514 9th St., made the announcement Tuesday in a Facebook post. The post said deciding to close was a "tough decision" that was made after much consideration, and the bar will close April 1. "We appreciate the long history of City Limits in the community and want to thank all of our wonderful guests and employees over these past years," the post continued. "We hope this location is quickly filled with a concept that meets the community's needs." Those with gift cards are encouraged to use them before the bar closes. In the months leading up to Tuesday's announcement, the bar was closed multiple times for maintenance, according to Facebook posts. No specific reason for the closure was mentioned. People are also reading… This Christian school in Davenport has grown beyond its building and now seeks a new one Davenport man accused of sexually abusing and secretly videoing child Dave & Buster's coming to Davenport early next year Enrollment at Illinois’ regional universities is plummeting, but solutions hard to come by Congratulations to Quad-City Times Player of the Week, Davenport North's Derek Pena Poynton, CCA too much for Davenport North in Class 4A showdown Teaching is a family tradition for these four Moline educators Eldridge-based LMT Defense awarded contract with U.S. Special Operations Command 5 Takeaways from Iowa’s loss to Iowa State: A drive that will define Mark Gronowski's Hawkeye tenure Food truck adds restaurant; halal, soul food spots open and more Quad-Cities business news Bettendorf man charged for August collision that injured pedestrian Chocolate Manor & Ghost Chicken open, Zeke's at Steeplegate Inn closed, and more Quad-Cities business news Vote for this week's Quad-City Times Player of the Week Kenneth Wayne Ewoldt Tom Martin: Press shutting down doesn't mean less news or later delivery The bar is operated by Food, Drinks, Friends, Inc., a restaurant group that owns the Tangled Wood in Bettendorf, Steventon's and Blue Iguana in LeClaire and most recently signed a deal with the city of Bettendorf to operate the Palmer Grill, which will open April 1. Subscribe today and support local journalism! Under the contract, the city will pay Food, Drink, Friends, Inc. $4,000 a month to operate Palmer Grill, 2999 Middle Rd, Bettendorf. The city and restaurant group would split the losses and/or profits. The city closed Palmer Grill at the end of 2022 after the grill’s food and beverage manager resigned. 0 Comments Love 2 Funny 4 Wow 2 Sad 6 Angry 5 The business news you need Get the latest local business news delivered FREE to your inbox weekly.
